document.title: Standards of Learning Documents for History & Social Science – Adopted 2008

FCC9B6819E194381AE5B6CC88A2C858F.description: analyzing the increasing impact of terrorism.

042DD317E9DD4959A19D6BBFCE06DCAD.description: describing economic interdependence, including the rise of multinational corporations, international organizations, and trade agreements;

CC5B62E1348F4650A3A3DF3786D8BB23.description: assessing the impact of economic development and global population growth on the environment and society, including an understanding of the links between economic and political freedom;

0E42C62CFC6440EFBCF6F53C642FD129.description: identifying contemporary political issues, with emphasis on migrations of refugees and others, ethnic/religious conflicts, and the impact of technology, including chemical and biological technologies;

4F2E60AE073947BEAD8DB114B3DA13CC.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of cultural, economic, and social conditions in developed and developing nations of the contemporary world by

482203AA33AF4F68BB9C88411425AE97.description: locating the geographic distribution of religions in the contemporary world.

DF939C2243E64E97A1BD5868786CFE9D.description: describing their beliefs, sacred writings, traditions, and customs;

D498EDC9FE724688A2FC9EE78CE04B4C.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the influence of Judaism, Christianity, Islam, Buddhism, and Hinduism in the contemporary world by

86EB7B433C2A4A3E8741F01548DD1DC7.description: describing the end of the mandate system and the creation of states in the Middle East, including the roles of Golda Meir and Gamal Abdul Nasser.

C9166452A420469C8A9A9CF1823FEFD3.description: describing Africa’s achievement of independence, including Jomo Kenyatta’s leadership of Kenya and Nelson Mandela’s role in South Africa;

DAA14D5E89D6405D882852A02CD9813F.description: describing the struggles for self-rule, including Gandhi’s leadership in India and the development of India’s democracy;

F2C92D68D5314513B4D252F77F004CD8.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of political, economic, social, and cultural aspects of independence movements and development efforts by

819A3B8A2E974E21AC6170533BB99A4B.description: describing major contributions of selected world leaders in the second half of the twentieth century, including Indira Gandhi, Margaret Thatcher, Mikhail Gorbachev, and Deng Xiaoping.

422A9F52970E496AAAF196710269A1C9.description: describing conflicts and revolutionary movements in eastern Asia, including those in China and Vietnam, and their major leaders, i.e., Mao Tse-tung (Zedong), Chiang Kai-shek, and Ho Chi Minh;

E3D614DCAE73466DA1395CB7EAF841D6.description: assessing the impact of nuclear weaponry on patterns of conflict and cooperation since 1945;

34E2251BDB0D457A80449872DFBC5024.description: explaining key events of the Cold War, including the competition between the American and Soviet economic and political systems and the causes of the collapse of communism in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe;

E0CF01C2A6394816A9D58526D8CD8241.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of major events in the second half of the twentieth century by

CD61428962334ED3AF80B2FDDDA095CB.description: The Post War Period, 1945 to the Present

75E0B52421DA417CB2A1F4FE1295F922.description: explaining the terms of the peace, the war crimes trials, the division of Europe, plans to rebuild Germany and Japan, and the creation of international cooperative organizations and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948).

E1904B6B405D4BF4BA624A8241BBA910.description: examining the Holocaust and other examples of genocide in the twentieth century;

BE7136636DD44846987985FC5DC7A698.description: explaining economic and political causes, describing major events, and identifying leaders of the war, with emphasis on Franklin D. Roosevelt, Harry Truman, Dwight D. Eisenhower, Douglas MacArthur, George C. Marshall, Winston Churchill, Joseph Stalin, Adolf Hitler, Hideki Tojo, and Hirohito;

A4E1138559FA4405A6FAAD3FAFE81C53.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the worldwide impact of World War II by

F8267F660E0B49CB8F92805A46A1F4BA.description: examining events related to the rise, aggression, and human costs of dictatorial regimes in the Soviet Union, Germany, Italy, and Japan, and identifying their major leaders, i.e., Joseph Stalin, Adolf Hitler, Benito Mussolini, Hirohito, and Hideki Tojo.

BD9C010900F744E09D5A41BD9BBF2876.description: citing causes and assessing the impact of worldwide depression in the 1930s;

6F9D32E1C943403588A307807E6BA898.description: describing the League of Nations and the mandate system;

4AF90A10AD224E5093A19D9CB45DA49D.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of political, economic, social, and cultural developments during the Interwar Period by

399EF2263CEA420985DB1E4996089EA2.description: citing causes and consequences of the Russian Revolution.

C8E764EFA29046218B2700743E4C6866.description: explaining the outcomes and global effect of the war and the Treaty of Versailles;

FD1A4871A7324854878C73ADC341614B.description: explaining economic causes, political causes, and major events and identifying major leaders of the war, with emphasis on Woodrow Wilson and Kaiser Wilhelm II;

5C351A514C6B4C58BD55A08A90EC5E51.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the worldwide impact of World War I by

7FC9F6C65E84467B846B83582188C3C6.description: assessing the impact of European economic and military power on Asia and Africa, with emphasis on the competition for resources and the responses of colonized peoples.

A4E8FC462E284F1E8E5CC1D1F75EE546.description: explaining the rise of industrial economies and their link to imperialism and nationalism;

CEACCDED722E432CBB71C367C639F2AA.description: describing the evolution of the nature of work and the labor force, including its effects on families, the status of women and children, the slave trade, and the labor union movement;

1FD560487951412FAD81248F9EB9522A.description: explaining the emergence of capitalism as a dominant economic pattern, and the subsequent development of socialism and communism;

298692D1301048FF988BABEF13CAD9DF.description: citing scientific, technological, and industrial developments and explaining how they brought about urbanization and social and environmental changes;

01CB6B2B90384230A43A39CAC20C040C.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the effects of the Industrial Revolution during the nineteenth century by

DB6BF02F77BA48CA9FE9CA6CEBF1D218.description: explaining events related to the unification of Germany and the role of Bismarck.

ED7542407909435AA1A7091351FCA4FD.description: explaining events related to the unification of Italy and the role of Italian nationalists;

B19218EFBB20478EA4C12012E21CB97D.description: describing unsuccessful revolutions on the continent and political reform in the United Kingdom;

788430D720574C6F9EBA4D7533C582C0.description: assessing the impact of Napoleon and the Congress of Vienna, including changes in political boundaries in Europe after 1815;

C38B8222E51E4C9692B12D2155C9EB47.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of political and philosophical developments in Europe during the nineteenth century by

FE3E33E388774E2CBB2D12D8EB275071.description: assessing the impact of the Monroe Doctrine.

B0E41EFBED2E416CA329CFE973B4680A.description: explaining the contributions of Toussaint L’Ouverture and Simón Bolívar;

77EFBCDDC09344A997BC366C64E4B3B8.description: identifying the impact of the American and French Revolutions on Latin America;

741C65D52D6A4FF183A895A4B93F3853.description: describing the colonial system as it existed by 1800;

93D20E7BD97C427FA46C5AB1D04D622E.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the Latin American revolutions of the nineteenth century by

FC63882C321D45189F086D5A64934FBC.description: describing the expansion of the arts, philosophy, literature, and new technology.

01C286F4C0F44B7187E9AC1260AF7CFC.description: explaining the political, religious, and social ideas of the Enlightenment and the ways in which they influenced the founders of the United States;

29A5F2F1BB18428797DE755DC30EF3B7.description: assessing the impacts of the English Civil War and the Glorious Revolution on democracy;

EB962C07BE9F437E829BFCDF2A704843.description: describing the Age of Absolutism, including the monarchies of Louis XIV and Peter the Great;

AF85C4D7256A4D42B3AE91E487955FA3.description: describing the Scientific Revolution and its effects;

5CF60EF1B13D49D998B29BE23B432BAF.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of scientific, political, economic, and religious changes during the sixteenth, seventeenth, and eighteenth centuries by

6DDA19CEF6BB4A4A9076CB273DE0DCD0.description: describing the growth of European nations, including the Commercial Revolution and mercantilism.

C42587F0C5C44FB4B8A18713CED07FAE.description: describing Africa and its increasing involvement in global trade;

C4752A3A5FD8471C8917036C74043A7E.description: describing East Asia, including China and the Japanese shogunate;

C814BC63FA8C4FB2BC5B3A9C4A190257.description: describing India, including the Mughal Empire and coastal trade;

9E2FADACDB254D4BB8E66FBA0499ABBF.description: describing the location and development of the Ottoman Empire;

F6B102CE26C341D29450D1E0954C9A18.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the status and impact of global trade on regional civilizations of the world after 1500 A.D. (C.E.) by

5261E438F0794A7EA75B34A505FFB938.description: describing the impact of precious metal exports from the Americas.

136214A6374B484BA4A4932E0A1780C1.description: mapping and explaining the triangular trade;

1429AE9397B240329F32B1E6CA326951.description: describing the Columbian Exchange, including its impact on native populations;

F280574C872A49ADBE6A02E4D18B84C5.description: explaining migration, settlement patterns, cultural diffusion, and social classes in the colonized areas;

6B6D37F63C074A46AB3BC5245C56B23B.description: explaining the roles and economic motivations of explorers and conquistadors;

C41FC6DA1EDF4EFABB88DFC86E9BFBE5.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the impact of the European Age of Discovery and expansion into the Americas, Africa, and Asia by

B92B03FFAF28436F82F42C55BC5CD920.description: describing changing cultural values, traditions, and philosophies, and assessing the role of the printing press.

909D19343BE94B7A917EB879C6460609.description: describing the impact of religious conflicts, the Inquisition, and the Catholic Reformation on society and government actions;

56AB102BDE144774BD59431951A60C1B.description: explaining the effects of the theological, political, and economic differences that emerged, including the views and actions of Martin Luther, John Calvin, Henry VIII, and Elizabeth I;

455B220F5073401F940AD1D6F96F3792.description: The student will demonstrate knowledge of the Reformation in terms of its impact on Western civilization by

7217F0878A10487DA6BD2AA94CE86388.description: Emergence of a Global Age, 1500 to 1650 A.D. (C.E.)

1F41B064B38A4DEC8C0E433FEC5A0FFE.description: describing the distribution of major religions;

D5B4ADEFDEAC45C689DA94D9E3FC6F68.description: describing artistic, literary, and intellectual ideas of the Renaissance;

E77A7771FB214FAAB3575CAE4F82AD9A.description: The student will demonstrate an understanding of the political, cultural, geographic, and economic conditions in the world about 1500 A.D. (C.E.) by

4B5E071CC0404EB1ABB463A1B7C7E380.description: analyzing the impact of economic forces, including taxation, government spending, trade, resources, and monetary systems, on events since 1500 A.D. (C.E.).

AE3960C6C16D42729D1E9F5141420A91.description: analyzing trends in human migration and cultural interaction from 1500 A.D. (C.E.) to the present;

6F1C0210C30A4B719EFDB1B4FD19443C.description: identifying and comparing political boundaries with the locations of civilizations, empires, and kingdoms from 1500 A.D. (C.E.) to the present;

B32C6C7648C9484AB6AF9994499DC27A.description: identifying geographic features important to the study of world history since 1500 A.D. (C.E.);

1246F982EB344B5C871227F5162FA06D.description: using maps, globes, artifacts, and pictures to analyze the physical and cultural landscapes of the world and to interpret the past since 1500 A.D. (C.E.);

3595C757F52D4AAEA7425C810A439E7E.description: identifying, analyzing, and interpreting primary and secondary sources to make generalizations about events and life in world history since 1500 A.D. (C.E.);
